name: Stuck in a Chamber Quiz | Marvel Comics | 10 Questions

questions.text: "Jono" could fire energy blasts. From what part of his body did these come?
questions.explanation:
His chest.

	When his power first manifested, Jono blew off his lower mouth and upper chest, leaving him able to speak only telepathically. He does not need to breathe or eat.

questions.text: Jono is completely immune to the "Death Force" of Omega Red.
questions.explanation:
True.

	There are two theories concerning Jono and his psionic energy. One theory is that the psionic energy sustains him, as he does not have several vital organs. Another is that his body is simply a shell, and he is really made up entirely of psionic energy. This would explain why Omega Red has no power over him.

questions.text: Which mutant attacked Generation X, only to be convinced by Jono to cease her attacks?
questions.explanation:
Penance.

	Penance has red skin, and thus can sympathize with the freakish-looking Jono. Because of this, he was able to convince her to stop attacking the newly-made team.

questions.text: Which fellow member of Generation X was Jono romatically involved with?
questions.explanation:
Husk.

	Husk is Paige Guthrie, younger sister of Sam Guthrie, also known as Cannonball. She can shed her skin, revealing a new layer underneath. This new skin can be made of granite, diamond, or nearly anything else. Paige has also been romantically linked to Warren Worthington.

questions.text: What government program restored Jono's damaged body?
questions.explanation:
Weapon X.

	Agent Brent Jackson of Weapon X offered to help an imprisoned Jono, who readily accepted. Weapon X has also had a hand in the lives of Wolverine and Sabretooth, and they seem to hinder more than they help.

questions.text: Jono was sent to investigate the sudden rash of murders that hit Empire State University. The victims were all mutants, but which mutant stayed behind after the fact?
questions.explanation:
Amber.

	Amber was a reptillian mutant who decided to stay in the college even after ESU shut their mutant student program down. She and Jono got to know each other during his investigation, one of his first actions as an X-Man.

questions.text: Jono joined the team of retired superheroes known as Excelsior.
questions.explanation:
False.

	It was a young Geoffrey Wilder that posed as Jono, not the real Jono Starsmore. These events took place in the comic book series "Runaways", originally written by Brian K. Vaughan.

questions.text: Jono was not affected by the events of Decimation.
questions.explanation:
False.

	When the Scarlet Witch went insane and changed reality to suit her own liking, many mutants lost their powers, resulting in mayhem and some deaths. With his psionic energy gone, Jono was left on life support because he was missing some internal organs.

questions.text: While recuperating in a hospital, Jono was abducted by forces loyal to the villainous mutant Apocalypse. Where was Jono recuperating?
questions.explanation:
England.

	Clan Akkaba, a group serving Apocalypse, spirited Jono's damaged body away and completely retooled him, enhancing his powers to unheard of levels and making him look like a smaller version of Apocalypse in the process.

Guitar.

	Jono is talented at playing the guitar as well as picking locks. It is rare that a mutant finds time to pursue instruments!
